text: are you guys looking for a great new
recipe to making your slow cooker hmm I
know you are because people are always
asking me for slow cooker recipes
today's recipe is a slow cooker chicken
curry it's a win-win situation
start off by getting your seasonings
ready it's gonna be two onions thinly
sliced it's got some good stuff going on
in here I'm not gonna lie for ease I'm
going to just mix all of my flavorings
together in a bowl and put them into my
slow cooker if you have a little bit
more time you can take the time to brown
your chicken or saute your onions and
garlic go ahead and do that that can
only add flavor add the onions to a bowl
with three pounds of skinless boneless
chicken thighs one of my favorites for
the slow cooker because it doesn't get
too dried out in the long cooking time
then about 16 thin slices of ginger a
good amount of ginger I'm sure that too
much is too much for some people but
it's almost never enough for me the
ginger can go in with your onion and
chicken now add 8 cloves of garlic
thinly sliced a teaspoon of ground
coriander if you do one extra step I
suggest sauteing your onions and garlic
and ginger with these spices so the
spices get a little toast on them this
is a teaspoon of ground cumin and a
couple tablespoons of curry powder I
talk about it all the time and I really
like my spices toasted but I'm trying to
make it easy here so you choose and two
teaspoons of coarse salt
toss it together I wouldn't worry about
getting it too perfectly mixed all of
this stuff is gonna start creating
juices in the slow cooker as it cooks
for four hours and everything will melt
together so just pour it right into your
slow cooker all right get the cover on
turn it to high and then let it cook
until the chicken is fork tender about
four hours
to finish off you're gonna add two cups
of coconut milk unsweetened not the
coconut cream don't use that yuck and
two packages of frozen peas all you
really want to do at this point is get
everything heated through and melded so
that can take up to 20 minutes might be
a little bit less let it get nice and
warm and heated through see you in about
20 all right let's eat it doesn't look
that much different but it's heated
through which is great you may be
noticing little bits of white on top
that is the coconut milk I used one
without stabilizers which I think it's
good but it looks a little bit funny so
don't be afraid of that it's fine
spoon it up it's nice and juicy if you
wanted to and I highly recommend it
actually make a little bit of rice to
serve with this because these juices are
what you want to be eating spoon that in
and then to serve some cilantro leaves
because I always put cilantro and
everything goes I'm a crazy person and
some toasted chopped cashews for a
little bit of crunch
chicken curry in a slow cooker is
fantastic
enjoy
